revised_title: Investigating the Natural Heat of Animals and the Role of Phosphorus
tldr: The author, Cromwell Mortimer, investigates the natural heat of animals and concludes that it is generated by the interaction of phosphoreal (phosphorus-containing) and aereal (air) particles within the animal's fluids. The heart and arteries play a role in exciting this heat by facilitating the motion of these particles and increasing their contact frequency.
